document_data.name: Bloomridge
document_data.mainbody:
'''Bloomridge''' was a wealthy district within the [[Lower City]] of [[Baldur's Gate]] located on the western half of [[Gray Harbor]] south of the Old Wall. It was home to the wealthier citizens of the Lower City, the merchants, landowners and sea captains who sought a lifestyle that more closely resembled that of the wealthy [[patriar]] of the [[Upper City]].

By great feats of engineering, both structural and [[arcane]], Bloomridge was partially built into the Old Wall that separated the Upper and Lower Cities.
document_data.Description:
The district was highlighted by the grand manor-houses that, on occasion, took up entire city blocks of Bloomridge. Between these palatial estates were cafes, restaurants and boutique shops that were connected by a series of open-air sweeping staircases that descended to street level. Hanging gardens, open galleries and rooftop terraces served to beautify the streets of Bloomridge even further.

Many of the buildings in Bloomridge featured ground-level businesses with upper-story apartment complexes, many of which offered great views over the bay. By the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]] there was little available housing and those that were open for rent were exceedingly expensive.
document_data.Crime: As of [[1492 DR]] [[The Guild]] Kingpin of Bloomridge was [[Goblin Behnie]], whose gang provided a source for forged Watch tokens, visitor licenses, and docking permits.<ref>Adam Lee, Christopher Perkins (September 17, 2019). ''Baldur's Gate: Descent into Avernus''. (Wizards of the Coast), p. 172. ISBN 0786966769.

Notable Locations.Residences:
* [[Mandorcai's mansion]]: This eyesore of a building appeared seemingly out of nowhere, bringing additional mysteries that plagued the authorities of the Lower City.
* [[Seskergates]]: Located adjacent to Mandorcai's, this tower of a manse was purchased by the eccentric [[wizard]] [[Imbralym Skoond]].
* [[Coran's Manor]]: Home to [[Coran]], member of the [[Parliament of Peers]] and former adventurer.
* [[Sands Korek]]'s home: Home of a successful merchant and (secretly) a high-ranking [[Zariel]] cultist. A secret entrance from the home led to a tunnel which accessed a subterranean temple dedicated to Zariel.<ref>{{Cite adventurers league/Hungry Shadows|5}}
Notable Locations.Taverns and Inns: * [[Smilin' Boar|The Smilin' Boar]]: One of Bloomridge's most trendy cafés, the Boar was previously a failing tavern.
